item.title: Details on this website
item.description: These pages were setup using Hugo and Congo.

item.title: PhD details
item.description: PhD situation #My PhD takes place between Sherbrooke (Québec, Canada) and Paris (France).

item.title: Codes
item.description: ISF (MATLAB) #ISF and BDIFFMIN are available at Software Heritage and its functioning described in this pdf.

item.title: Presentations
item.description: Posters # Nonsmooth OPTimization and Applications (NOPTA) picture, Antwerpen, Belgium, April 2024, “A Differentiability Problem solved by Discrete Geometry”.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Pursuing arrangements # After having considered symmetric and arbitrary hyperplane arrangements, we are considering extending the methods to the computation of the “subchambers” (the sets that are contained in at least one of the hyperplanes), i.

item.title: Situation
item.description: I am a PhD student at Université de Sherbrooke, in the BISOUS team (in French), and at Inria Paris, in the SERENA team, supervised by Jean-Pierre Dussault (Sherbrooke) and Jean Charles Gilbert (Paris) since April 2021.

item.description: Some information regarding the classes I was assistant in.
